revisions.revision: Removed Veegie's garbage values, fixed seats tagblock and added seats intraflexives.

enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps on Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object passes all function values to parent and uses parent's markers

bit.name: Attach To Clusters By Dynamic Sphere
bit.tooltip: use this for the mac gun on spacestation

bit.name: Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: marine 1.0, grunt 1.4, elite 0.9, hunter 0.5, etc.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringId.name: Import Name
stringId.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringId.name: Turn Off With
stringId.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags16.name: Game Engine Flags
flags16.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones
These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagRef.name: Health Pack Equipment
tagRef.tooltip: MUST be an equipment tag that implements the "Health Pack" block

bit.name: Flashlight Power Doesnt Transfer To Weapon
Allow Aim While Opening Or Closing

comment.title: Camera Scale X MIN(Scale X POWER((K X X), Power), Maximum)

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Distance Of Dive Animation
float32.tooltip: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

tagRef.name: Spawned Turret Character
tagRef.tooltip: automatically created character when this unit is driven

stringid.name: Right Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the primary weapon is attached

stringid.name: Left Hand Node
stringid.tooltip: where the seconday weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)

stringid.name: Preferred Gun Node
stringid.tooltip: if found, use this gun marker

tagblock.name: Seats

bit.name: Locked
bit.tooltip: when occupied, prevents enemies from entering locked seats

bit.name: First Person Camera Slaved To Gun
AI Firing Disabled By Maximum Acceleration

float32.name: Turnover Time
float32.tooltip: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

float32.name: Listener Interpolation Factor
float32.tooltip: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

tagblock.comment: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

float32.name: Pitch Interpolation Time
float32.tooltip: 0 means use default 17

float32.name: Minimum Speed Reference
float32.tooltip: Initial t is computed from velocity/(max speed - min speed)

float32.name: Speed Exponent
float32.tooltip: if >0, t is then modified by raising to this exponent and result is used to linearly interpolate yaw/pitch rates

comment.title: Camera Scale X MIN(Scale X POWER((K X X), Power), Maximum)

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Entry Radius
float32.tooltip: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from marker forward the unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Facing Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from unit facing the marker must be

plugin.comment: define one of the following blocks for the type of physics you wish this vehicle to have.

tagblock.name: Human Tank Type

degree.name: Forward Arc
degree.tooltip: outside of this arc the vehicle reverse direciton, around 110 degrees seems to be nice...

float32.name: Forward Turn Scale
float32.tooltip: think of this as oversteer

float32.name: Reverse Turn Scale
float32.tooltip: think of this as oversteer

tagblock.comment: how quickly the differential reaches it's target and what the ratio is
how quickly the differential reaches it's target and what the ratio is

float32.name: Engine Moment
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Engine Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Gravity Adjust
float32.tooltip: 0-1 fraction by which we scale gravity that is not along the ground plane

tagblock.name: Human Jeep Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

float32.name: Engine Moment
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Engine Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Gravity Adjust
float32.tooltip: 0-1 fraction by which we scale gravity that is not along the ground plane

tagblock.name: Human Plane Type

float32.name: Flying Torque Scale
float32.tooltip: big vehicles need to scale this down. 0 defaults to 1, which is generally a good value.

float32.name: Air Friction Deceleration
float32.tooltip: human plane physics only. 0 is nothing. 1 is like thowing the engine to full reverse

float32.name: Thrust Scale
float32.tooltip: human plane physics only. 0 is default (1)

float32.name: Turn Rate Scale When Boosting
float32.tooltip: this was originally added for the sentinel enforce, but I could see other uses. 0 defaults to 1

tagblock.comment: This data controls the depiction of steering through animation - not the vehicles ability to turn

float32.name: Interpolation Scale
float32.tooltip: how much we interpolate between steering poses. 1= heavy interp. of steering animations

degree.name: Maximum Angle
degree.tooltip: max animated steering angle change allowed per tick. non-zero= max angle delta per frame

tagblock.name: Alien Scout Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

enum8.name: Specific Type
enum8.tooltip: different types are treated differently alien scout controller

float32.name: Torque Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 1

stringid.name: Object Function Damage Region
stringid.tooltip: this is the name of the region by which we gauge the overall damage of the vehicle

rangef.name: Anti-Gravity Engine Speed
rangef.tooltip: speed at which engine position function moves. value of 1 means goes from 0-1 in 1 second

float32.name: Engine Speed Acceleration
float32.tooltip: strictly used for object function. in 0-1 space

float32.name: Maximum Vehicle Speed
float32.tooltip: function is capped by speed of the vehicle. So when we slow down for any reason we see the function go down

stringid.name: Object Function Damage Region
stringid.tooltip: this is the name of the region by which we gauge the overall damage of the vehicle

rangef.name: Anti-Gravity Engine Speed
rangef.tooltip: speed at which engine position function moves. value of 1 means goes from 0-1 in 1 second

float32.name: Engine Speed Acceleration
float32.tooltip: strictly used for object function. in 0-1 space

float32.name: Maximum Vehicle Speed
float32.tooltip: function is capped by speed of the vehicle. So when we slow down for any reason we see the function go down

rangef.name: Gear Rotation Speed
rangef.tooltip: cycles per second idle to full throttle

tagblock.comment: This data controls the depiction of steering through animation - not the vehicles ability to turn

float32.name: Interpolation Scale
float32.tooltip: how much we interpolate between steering poses. 1= heavy interp. of steering animations

degree.name: Maximum Angle
degree.tooltip: max animated steering angle change allowed per tick. non-zero= max angle delta per frame

tagblock.name: Alien Fighter Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0
how hard the vehicle trys to rotate to it's desired rotation

float32.name: Flying Torque Scale
float32.tooltip: big vehicles need to scale this down. 0 defaults to 1, which is generally a good value.

tagblock.comment: this offset will be aligned to the units aiming vector instead of the vehicle forward vector

tagblock.name: Mantis Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

vector3.name: Maximum Leg Motion
vector3.tooltip: in WU, how far can we displace the legs in x,y,z each step

float32.name: Maximum Turn
float32.tooltip: in degrees, how much can this walker turn in one step

int8.name: Leg Side Order
int8.tooltip: for each side order the legs from 0-n where 0 is the most forward leg

vector3.name: Runtime Initial Origin To Hip Offset
Runtime Pivot Center To Hip Offset

float32.name: Leg Apex Fraction
float32.tooltip: 0-1 fraction. where the leg tansitions from lift to drop

float32.name: Lift Exponent
float32.tooltip: x(0-1) power exponent

float32.name: Drop Exponent
float32.tooltip: x(0-1) power exponent

float32.name: Walk Cycle Pause
float32.tooltip: fraction of walkcycle at end for pause

int16.name: Stable Planted Legs
int16.tooltip: number of legs mantis needs planted to be considered stable.

float32.name: Jump Set Interpolation Fraction
float32.tooltip: 0-1, portion of set time spent interpolating into neutral stance

float32.name: Jump Recovery Fraction
float32.tooltip: 0-1, portion of recovery time spent interpolating into neutral stance

float32.name: Jump Leg Set Distance
float32.tooltip: WU, amount foot moves up to get ready to jump

float32.name: Jump Leg Distance
float32.tooltip: WU, amount foot moves down when jumping

tagblock.name: VTOL Type

rangef.name: Rise Target Lag
rangef.tooltip: minimum is how much you can lag with with out acceleration and maximum is lag with acceleration

float32.name: Rotor Damping
float32.tooltip: maxes out around 30

tagblock.comment: this simulates the engines being on a pivot like on an osprey. This helps better cradle the center of mass.

float32.name: Magic Angular Acceleration Exponent
float32.tooltip: magic force that torques vehicle back towards up

float32.name: Magic Angular Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: magic force that torques vehicle back towards up

float32.name: Magic Angular Acceleration k
float32.tooltip: magic force that torques vehicle back towards up

degree.name: Lift Angles Acceleration
degree.tooltip: how fast can the engine animations accelerate their turn in degrees/SQR(sec)

degree.name: Render Lift Angles Acceleration
degree.tooltip: how fast can the engine animations accelerate their turn in degrees/SQR(sec)

rangef.name: Propeller Rotation Speed
rangef.tooltip: cycles per second idle to full throttle

tagblock.name: Chopper Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

float32.name: Engine Moment
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Engine Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Magic Turning Scale
float32.tooltip: scale up the magic force

float32.name: Magic Turning Acceleration
float32.tooltip: (degrees/pow(sec,2))rate at which the turning tries to accelerate

float32.name: Magic Turning Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: (degrees/sec)rate at which vehicl tries to turn

float32.name: Bank To Slide Ratio
float32.tooltip: (WU/sec)the slide velocity at which we achieve full bank

float32.name: Bank To Turn Ratio
float32.tooltip: (WU/sec)the slide velocity at which we achieve full bank

float32.name: Bank Fraction
float32.tooltip: fraction of possible tire drop when we bank. 0 is full bank 1 is no bank.

float32.name: Bank Rate
float32.tooltip: bank fraction velocity. (0-1 fraction / sec)

float32.name: Wheel Acceleration
float32.tooltip: acceleration of the wheel towards the engine speed

float32.name: Gyroscopic Damping
float32.tooltip: 0==none, 30==damn near full damping

tagblock.name: Guardian Type
tagblock.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

float32.name: Torque Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 1

float32.name: Ground Friction
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Depth
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Damp Factor
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Moving Friction
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Maximum Slope 0
float32.tooltip: degrees 0-90

float32.name: Ground Maximum Slope 1
float32.tooltip: degrees 0-90. and greater than slope 0

float32.name: Maximum Normal Force Contribution
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 3, this prevents the physics from becoming unstable when hucked against a surface

float32.name: Anti Gravity Bank Lift
float32.tooltip: lift per WU.

float32.name: Steering Bank Reaction Scale
float32.tooltip: how quickly we bank when we steer

float32.name: Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: value of 0 defaults to 1. .5 is half gravity

float32.name: Maximum Update Distance
float32.tooltip: WU. if a friciton point moves more than this distance it must update

float32.name: Maximum Update Period
float32.tooltip: Seconds. a friction point of this vehicle must update a least this often when controlled by a local player.

float32.name: Maximum Remote Update Period
float32.tooltip: Seconds. a friction point of this vehicle must update a least this often when controlled by an ai or remote player.

float32.name: Fraction Of Total Mass
float32.tooltip: (0.0-1.0) fraction of total vehicle mass

float32.name: Damaged Radius
float32.tooltip: radius when the tire is blown off.

enum16.name: Model State Destroyed
enum16.tooltip: only need point can destroy flag set

stringId.name: Region Name
stringId.tooltip: only need point can destroy flag set

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: User Data
uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime List Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to where the child shapes for this list start in memory at runtime. don't poke me

float32.name: w Axis-Aligned Bounding Box Half Extents

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: User Data
uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Multi Sphere 0 Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to the start of the first multi sphere shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Multi Sphere 1 Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to the start of the first multi sphere shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Multi Sphere 2 Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to the start of the first multi sphere shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Multi Sphere 3 Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to the start of the first multi sphere shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum8.name: Vehicle Size
enum8.tooltip: The size determine what kind of seats in larger vehicles it may occupy (i.e. small or large cargo seats)

int8.name: Complex Suspension Sample Count
int8.tooltip: How many additional raycasts to perform per side of a tire.

float32.name: Seat Entrance Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: how much do we scale the force the biped the applies down on the seat when he enters. 0 == no acceleration

float32.name: Seat Exit Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: how much do we scale the force the biped the applies down on the seat when he exits. 0 == no acceleration

Rider Boost Damage Effect or Response
